items.message: No further flood impacts are expected in this area, and the flood alert has been removed for the North Sea Coast at Bridlington this morning (Thursday). We will continue to monitor the situation and issue alerts and warnings as necessary.

River levels have risen at the Mansfield The Dykes river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from today, 20/10/22.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow on 21/10/22.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. 

This message will be updated by this evening, 20/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leen, Day Brook and Tottle Brook in Nottinghamshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Leen, Day Brook, Tottle Brook

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Bulwell river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  
Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is today, 20/10/22.  
Areas most at risk are low-lying recreational areas and roads including High School playing fields on Valley Road and other low lying land and recreational areas, low lying land and roads around the Tottle Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow on 21/10/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated this evening, 20/10/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Trent, River Greet, Potwell Dyke, Carr Dyke, Dover Beck, Cocker Beck, Thurgarton Beck, Fairham Brook

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Lowdham river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  
Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 20/10/22.  
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around the tributaries of the River Trent in Nottinghamshire, the River Greet, Potwell Dyke, Dover Beck, Cocker Beck, Woodborough Brook, Ouse Dyke, Thurgarton Beck and others.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow on 21/10/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated by this evening, 20/10/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Foulness and Market Weighton catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Foulness, Market Weighton Canal, North Cave Beck, Ellerker Beck, Mill Beck

items.message: The Flood Alert for the River Foulness and Market Weighton remains in force. This afternoonâ€™s (Thursday 20th October 2022) persistent rainfall caused river levels to rise quickly, the river has now peaked and is falling slowly. Further rainfall this evening may see levels rise again and is why the alert remains in force. The area of particular concern is around South Cave, and flooding may occur on low lying roads, farmlands and paths in this area. We are monitoring the situation closely, and will update this message by 20:00 today, or as the situation changes.

Friday morning's tide at 09:30 AM is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with southerly force 7 winds and large waves.
Areas most at risk include Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon.

Flooding is possible at Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon between 09:00 AM and 10:30 AM on 21/10/2022.

The tide at 08:15 PM on 21/10/2022 is also currently forecast to be a Flood Alert, we will send an update once this current tide has passed.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Consider activating any property flood protection products in the Christchurch Harbour area.
This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 21/10/2022, or as the situation changes.
